SINGLE_ITEM_ID

public static final java.lang.String SINGLE_ITEM_ID
if you use STORAGE_SCHEME_SINGLE_ITEM in your node configuration, we'll use this as the item name (unless you pass one yourself, in which case we'll respect your itemID)

getItemID

public java.lang.String getItemID()
ID for this stored item. Note this must be unique within the node. Publishing an item with an existing itemID will overwrite the existing item.

public void setItemID(java.lang.String p_itemID)

Value actually being sent within this message.

getPublisherID

public java.lang.String getPublisherID()
[read-only] userID of the user who published this item. Depending on nodeConfigurations for this message, publishers may not be able to modify stored items they didn't publish themselves. Note : overwritten by the server, to prevent spoofing.

setPublisherID

public void setPublisherID(java.lang.String p_publisherID)

getAssociatedUserID

public java.lang.String getAssociatedUserID()
For nodeConfigurations with userDependentItems=true or modifyAnyItem=false, this property is used to determine the user associated with this item. This is typically the publisherID of the first userID to publish the item (owners may also publish items associated with other users), and almost never needs setting.

setAssociatedUserID

public void setAssociatedUserID(java.lang.String p_associatedUserID)

getRecipientID

public java.lang.String getRecipientID()
For nodes where allowPrivateMessages has been set to true, this field allows messages to be received by only *one* recipient. Note that for cases where groups of people are recipients, specialized nodes where those recipients have been promoted to be able to subscribe should be used. We do want to avoid the one-to-one private message case devolving to "one node per user", so recipientID allows this in a much simpler manner.

setRecipientID

public void setRecipientID(java.lang.String p_recipientID)

getTimeStamp

public int getTimeStamp()
[read-only] Time this message was broadcast (written on the server)

setTimeStamp

public void setTimeStamp(int p_timeStamp)

getCollectionName

public java.lang.String getCollectionName()
[read-only] Name of the CollectionNode this item belongs to

setCollectionName

public void setCollectionName(java.lang.String p_collectionName)

getRecipientIDs

public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getRecipientIDs()
For nodes where allowPrivateMessages has been set to true, this field allows messages to be received by multiple recipients. Note that recipients will not receive the entire recipientIDs array, only their own recipientID.

setRecipientIDs

public void setRecipientIDs(java.util.List<java.lang.String> p_recipientIDs)
